title: What actually is the Neolithic Age? - Quora

response.answer_text: Neo-lithic, or “new Stone Age”. This began at different points in time across the world. In the old world generally began around 10,000 years ago. Based on the sophistication of stone tools and early evidence of animal husbandry and simple agriculture. It is also about the time that sedentism began and wide spread hunting and gathering was ending. The development of new technologies is also evident such as the use of ceramics which is a precursor for the later Broze age. In the New world the Neolithic began some 2 to 3 thousand years ago. Sedentism, agriculture and ceramics 1000 years later.

It was simply the age where humans began to domesticate animals and crops for consumption. It happened at different times across the globe, but usually began about 10,000 bc or so. It ended the hunter gathering for many humans. It also allowed human populations to grow with surplus food production.
